title: Ping changed from consistent ~60 to consistent ~80
body:
I'm located in Spokane, Washington. My ping has been a solid 60-63ms ever since the servers moved. About a week or so ago, I started getting a few games where it jumped to 83 (not spikes, but just stayed there for the whole game), and then would go back down to ~60 for the next game. Then it just stayed up at 80, and has been there the last few days.

I went through the connection guide and tried everythere except port forwarding. I'm fairly certain that's not the issue - the only things I can think that might have changed between when it was 60 and now is Windows updates, or possibly something funky with my IP routing to Riot's servers. 

I've ruled out local network traffic - this is happening when I'm the only person using our network, and then while I'm only playing League.

I found this post: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/wYUEKyPm-high-ping

I followed the instructions left by the Rioter and ran a traceroute for 5-10 minutes. Here's the results:

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |

|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |

|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|

|        Destination network unreachable. -    1 |  660 |  658 |    0 |    1 |   14 |    0 |

|                   No response from host -  100 |  133 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |

|te-0-1-0-11-sur03.spokane.wa.seattle.comcast.net -    1 |  660 |  659 |    7 |   12 |   30 |   10 |

|be-37-ar01.burien.wa.seattle.comcast.net -    1 |  660 |  659 |   15 |   20 |   42 |   22 |

|        Destination network unreachable. -    1 |  660 |  658 |   16 |   20 |   38 |   18 |

|be-33650-cr01.seattle.wa.ibone.comcast.net -    1 |  660 |  659 |   35 |   40 |   73 |   43 |

|        Destination network unreachable. -    1 |  660 |  658 |   34 |   39 |   57 |   41 |

|                          50.248.116.194 -    1 |  660 |  659 |   34 |   38 |   56 |   43 |

|                          104.160.129.35 -    1 |  660 |  659 |   34 |   39 |   56 |   42 |

|          ae30-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -    1 |  660 |  659 |   75 |   80 |   98 |   79 |

|                           104.160.131.1 -    1 |  660 |  659 |   75 |   80 |  105 |   85 |

|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|

   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

EDIT: 

I ended up having a tech come out to my house. He tweaked a few things, tightened some connections, and it seemed to fix the problem - for a glorious two or three days I was back to 60 ping. Now it's back up to 80 again. No idea why. Might have just been a crazy coincidence that it seemed to fix itself when he was here.

It's pretty amazing how much of a difference 20 ping makes. Don't wanna be a drama queen, but it's really put me off of playing :(.

EDIT: Just got off the phone with them again. I finally got to talk to somebody that seemed to know what they were talking about. Basically they said there wasn't anything they could do immediately, but he did give me a credit on my bill and promised to escalate the issue and get back to me if they discovered anything.

I was given a number that is supposed to get directly to their advanced tech support team: Dial 1-800-934-6489, then press 1, press 1 again, then press 2. Basically what you're doing is working through the robot secretary to get to an agent, so if that exact sequence of number presses doesn't work than just do whatever the robot says to get to an agent.

replies.body: I'm having the same issues as you Hideous, and I also live in the Spokane area. I've added you on friends so I could ask you a bit about how your contact with Comcast went and if they ended up fixing it. I'm in the same boat, unfortunately.

Oh hey, sorry I think I rejected your friend request, I didn't see this post til just now.

I ended up having a tech come out to my house. He tweaked a few things, tightened some connections, and it seemed to fix the problem - for a glorious two or three days I was back to 60 ping. Now it's back up to 80 again. No idea why. Might have just been a crazy coincidence that it seemed to fix itself when he was here. 

It's pretty amazing how much of a difference 20 ping makes. Don't wanna be a drama queen, but it's really put me off of playing :(.

EDIT: Just got off the phone with them again. I finally got to talk to somebody that seemed to know what they were talking about. Basically they said there wasn't anything they could do immediately, but he did give me a credit on my bill and promised to escalate the issue and get back to me if they discovered anything.

I was given a number that is supposed to get directly to their advanced tech support team: Dial 1-800-934-6489, then press 1, press 1 again, then press 2. Basically what you're doing is working through the robot secretary to get to an agent, so if that exact sequence of number presses doesn't work than just do whatever the robot says to get to an agent.

Best of luck.

It looks like your connection is spiking at one of Comcast's node before ever reaching us.  I'd recommend reaching out to your ISP specialist who you can share this traceroute with.  They can investigate the issue and hopefully get you re-routed or that fixed up.  Hopefully, they'll be able to get this resolved so you can play without issue!

Any tips you can give me that would help with that conversation? I'm guessing I need to ask for technical assistance, and then provide them with the traceroute info? 

Thanks!

You may be able to specifically ask for a Tier 2 specialist, and let them know that there may be an issue with a specific node causing latency jumps.  At which point you should be able to share your route info with them!
Thank you. The tech is currently asking to schedule a tech to visit to "check the node at my place." Does that make sense?

You're on the right track, keep working with them.  I'm not sure that anything at your place would resolve this, but they may know (or see) more about what's going on.  Also, they may have their own regulations and workflows that they'll need to go through to get this done.  They should be able to get this fixed up, though, so hang tight!
Why in almost all of these ping related posts does Comcast show up? Is the company just an incompetent pile of poop?
well that and they pretty much monopolized the internet/cable in the US.
